div1.head: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to S.C. Mead, June 21, 1922
div1.opener:
C O P Y
WAR DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON
June 21, 1922.
Mr. S. C. Mead, Secretary,
The Merchants' Association of New York,
233 Broadway,
New York.
My dear Mr. Mead:
div1.p:
It is certainly refreshing to receive a letter
from you again. I remember very well our contact of years
ago in attempting to secure an appropriation for the
widows of the yellow fever victims. I know about Mr.
Anthony's inquiry with reference to this matter and you may
be very sure of my hearty accord in all that you say. The
Army Appropriation Bill which carries these appropriations
for this year is in conference today, and I will be pre-
pared for anything Mr. Anthony wants next year.

I am glad to know that you are still on the
job, and if anything comes up, I shall not hesitate to
call on you for assistance.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, (Signed) M. W. IRELAND,
Surgeon General, U. S. Army. MD
